reviewtext: I've had a Linksys gigabit switch for a few years and was never really pleased with it. Recently, it started acting up and finally gave out completely.I bought this 10/100 because it was cheap. I was a bit worried because it wasn't gigabit but it works fine. A network expert would probably tell me that a gigabit switch was surplus to requirements for home use. A 10/100 that works is infinitely better than a 10/100/1000 that doesn't work.I use this for streaming - Roku 2 XS, WD-TV, Sonos, Hopper. Actually, the Hopper is sort of a reverse streaming thing. It has a Slingbox on it.
